segment.source: This topic describes the new and changed functionality of the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE/WinPE) and compares it with previous versions of Windows PE and MS-DOS.
segment.target: This topic describes the new and changed functionality of the Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE/WinPE) and compares it with previous versions of Windows PE and MS-DOS.

segment.source: This table compares the features and functionality with those of previous versions of Windows PE:
segment.target: This table compares the features and functionality with those of previous versions of Windows PE:

segment.source: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, or Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, or Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, or Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, or Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: Doesn’t support: Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Doesn’t support: Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, or Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, or Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Scripts used to deploy Windows PE
segment.target: Scripts used to deploy Windows PE

segment.source: CopyPE updated for use with the Windows ADK.
segment.target: CopyPE updated for use with the Windows ADK.

segment.source: MakeWinPEMedia added to make creation of USB flash drives or ISO files easier.
segment.target: MakeWinPEMedia added to make creation of USB flash drives or ISO files easier.

segment.source: Windows PE 2.1: Oscdimg tool updated to support larger images.
segment.target: Windows PE 2.1: Oscdimg tool updated to support larger images.

segment.source: .NET Framework optional component renamed to WinPE_NetFx.
segment.target: .NET Framework optional component renamed to WinPE_NetFx.

segment.source: PowerShell optional component renamed to WinPE_PowerShell.
segment.target: PowerShell optional component renamed to WinPE_PowerShell.

segment.source: Winpeshl.ini allows you to launch apps with command-line parameters in quotes.
segment.target: Winpeshl.ini allows you to launch apps with command-line parameters in quotes.

segment.source: For more info, see Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts.
segment.target: For more info, see Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts.

segment.source: DISM supports Windows 10 and Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) features.
segment.target: DISM supports Windows 10 and Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) features.

segment.source: DISM supports Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 images but doesn’t support Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008 images.
segment.target: DISM supports Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 images but doesn’t support Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008 images.

segment.source: For more info, see DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows.
segment.target: For more info, see DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows.

segment.source: Image capturing tools included with new and commands.
segment.target: Image capturing tools included with new and commands.

segment.source: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.
segment.target: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.

segment.source: DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows added.
segment.target: DISM - Deployment Image Servicing and Management Technical Reference for Windows added.

segment.source: DISM is a command-line tool that you can use to customize a Windows or a Windows PE image.
segment.target: DISM is a command-line tool that you can use to customize a Windows or a Windows PE image.

segment.source: The PEImg and Pkgmgr tools are not supported in Windows PE 3.0.
segment.target: The PEImg and Pkgmgr tools are not supported in Windows PE 3.0.

segment.source: ImageX available as an optional application for capturing and applying images.
segment.target: ImageX available as an optional application for capturing and applying images.

segment.source: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.
segment.target: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.

segment.source: PEImg is used to service Windows PE images.
segment.target: PEImg is used to service Windows PE images.

segment.source: After you run PEImg /prep against the Windows PE 2.0 image, the image can't be modified.
segment.target: After you run PEImg /prep against the Windows PE 2.0 image, the image can't be modified.

segment.source: ImageX is available as an optional application for capturing and applying images.
segment.target: ImageX is available as an optional application for capturing and applying images.

segment.source: Pkgmgr is used to install, remove, or update Windows packages in offline images.
segment.target: Pkgmgr is used to install, remove, or update Windows packages in offline images.

segment.source: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.
segment.target: Doesn't support servicing Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2 images.

segment.source: The default amount of scratch space is 512 MB for PCs that have more than 1 GB of RAM.
segment.target: The default amount of scratch space is 512 MB for PCs that have more than 1 GB of RAM.

segment.source: The Windows PE 3.0 default image contains only the minimum resources to support most deployment scenarios.
segment.target: The Windows PE 3.0 default image contains only the minimum resources to support most deployment scenarios.

segment.source: You can add optional components by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM).
segment.target: You can add optional components by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM).

segment.source: The new command allows you to further reduce the contents of a Windows PE 3.0 image to only those files necessary to support a given set of apps.
segment.target: The new command allows you to further reduce the contents of a Windows PE 3.0 image to only those files necessary to support a given set of apps.

segment.source: Windows PE 2.1: Supports booting directly from the hard disk, not into RAM disk.
segment.target: Windows PE 2.1: Supports booting directly from the hard disk, not into RAM disk.

segment.source: Windows PE 2.1: Writable RAM drive: when booting from read-only media, Windows PE automatically creates a writable RAM disk (drive X) and allocates 32 megabytes (MB) of the RAM disk for general-purpose storage.
segment.target: Windows PE 2.1: Writable RAM drive: when booting from read-only media, Windows PE automatically creates a writable RAM disk (drive X) and allocates 32 megabytes (MB) of the RAM disk for general-purpose storage.

segment.source: You can customize the size, in megabytes, by using PEImg /scratchspace.
segment.target: You can customize the size, in megabytes, by using PEImg /scratchspace.

segment.source: File Management optional component added for discovering and restoring deleted files from unencrypted volumes.
segment.target: File Management optional component added for discovering and restoring deleted files from unencrypted volumes.

segment.source: Windows PE 3.1: base image contains improvements that are related to 4k/512e drive support.
segment.target: Windows PE 3.1: base image contains improvements that are related to 4k/512e drive support.

segment.source: Windows PE 3.0 includes all Hyper-V drivers except display drivers.
segment.target: Windows PE 3.0 includes all Hyper-V drivers except display drivers.

segment.source: This enables Windows PE to run in Hypervisor.
segment.target: This enables Windows PE to run in Hypervisor.

segment.source: Supported features include mass storage, mouse integration, and network adapters.
segment.target: Supported features include mass storage, mouse integration, and network adapters.

segment.source: Optional Remote Network Driver Interface Specification (RNDIS) feature added for enabling network devices that implement the RNDIS specification over USB.
segment.target: Optional Remote Network Driver Interface Specification (RNDIS) feature added for enabling network devices that implement the RNDIS specification over USB.

segment.source: The Windows PE 3.1 base image contains RNDIS binaries.
segment.target: The Windows PE 3.1 base image contains RNDIS binaries.

segment.source: Windows PE 3.0: Hotfix available for 802.1X (LAN) support.
segment.target: Windows PE 3.0: Hotfix available for 802.1X (LAN) support.

segment.source: Windows PE 3.1 includes 802.1X binaries as an optional component.
segment.target: Windows PE 3.1 includes 802.1X binaries as an optional component.

segment.source: The file name of this package is WinPE-Dot3Svc.cab.
segment.target: The file name of this package is WinPE-Dot3Svc.cab.

segment.source: Doesn't support other protocols, like Internetwork Packet Exchange/Sequenced Packet Exchange (IPX/SPX).
segment.target: Doesn't support other protocols, like Internetwork Packet Exchange/Sequenced Packet Exchange (IPX/SPX).

segment.source: Windows PE 2.1: Hotfix available for 802.1X (LAN) support.
segment.target: Windows PE 2.1: Hotfix available for 802.1X (LAN) support.

segment.source: WinRE Configuration utility added (winrecfg.exe) to support configuring Windows RE in an offline operating system.
segment.target: WinRE Configuration utility added (winrecfg.exe) to support configuring Windows RE in an offline operating system.

segment.source: Secure Startup optional component added for provisioning and managing BitLocker and the Trusted Platform Module.
segment.target: Secure Startup optional component added for provisioning and managing BitLocker and the Trusted Platform Module.

segment.source: Supports BitLocker and Trusted Platform Module.
segment.target: Supports BitLocker and Trusted Platform Module.

segment.source: Supports x86, x64, and ARM-based PCs.
segment.target: Supports x86, x64, and ARM-based PCs.

segment.source: Supports x86, x64, and Itanium-based PCs.
segment.target: Supports x86, x64, and Itanium-based PCs.

segment.source: To see which version of Windows PE you’re running, type and locate this registry key: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinPE.
segment.target: To see which version of Windows PE you’re running, type and locate this registry key: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinPE.

segment.source: Windows PE is similar to MS-DOS.
segment.target: Windows PE is similar to MS-DOS.

segment.source: It also includes support for the following features:
segment.target: It also includes support for the following features:

segment.source: The NTFS 5.x file system, including dynamic volume creation and management.
segment.target: The NTFS 5.x file system, including dynamic volume creation and management.

segment.source: TCP/IP networking and file sharing (client only).
segment.target: TCP/IP networking and file sharing (client only).

segment.source: A subset of the Windows application programming interface (API).
segment.target: A subset of the Windows application programming interface (API).

segment.source: CD, DVD, and USB flash drives.
segment.target: CD, DVD, and USB flash drives.

segment.source: Hyper-V drivers (all drivers except for display drivers).
segment.target: Hyper-V drivers (all drivers except for display drivers).

segment.source: This enables Windows PE to run in a hypervisor.
segment.target: This enables Windows PE to run in a hypervisor.

segment.source: Supported features include mass storage, mouse integration, and network adapters.
segment.target: Supported features include mass storage, mouse integration, and network adapters.

segment.source: Optional support for PowerShell, Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), Windows Data Access Components (Windows DAC), and HTML Applications (HTAs).
segment.target: Optional support for PowerShell, Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), Windows Data Access Components (Windows DAC), and HTML Applications (HTAs).
